snippet: As it opens its new $422 million Lower Manhattan home, the Whitney Museum of American Art is preparing for the challenge of paying to operate a larger building.
abstract: Whitney Museum of American Art faces financial challenges as it prepares to open in new building in lower Manhattan; operating expenses will be nearly 50 percent higher due to larger space, increased staff and expanded hours, but museum officials are confident that costs can be met with larger endowment and projected jump in attendance.
lead_paragraph: As it opens its new $422 million Lower Manhattan home, the Whitney Museum of American Art is preparing for the challenge of paying to operate a larger building.

headline.main: Whitney Museum Contemplates a Bigger Future, With Bigger Expenses
headline.print_headline: A Museum Contemplates the Cost of a Bigger Future
